isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - CATERPILLAR 3176B/3406E ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - 1994 - TROUBLESHOOTING

svcsubsecinfo.para: This section includes Troubleshooting Charts for International installed circuits and components that are part of the Caterpillar electronic engine control system.

para.emph: To begin the process, refer to the appropriate Caterpillar Electronic Troubleshooting manual and follow their directions.

svcsubsecinfo.para: If the Caterpillar diagnostics indicate that a International circuit is suspect, use the Troubleshooting Charts included in this section for a step-by-step procedure.
The Prolink EST with the Caterpillar cartridge can be used to read fault codes, customer and engine parameters, and monitor various switches and sensors.

svcproc.title: IMPORTANT STEPS BEFORE TESTING

step1.para: Gather information by talking to the driver if possible. Try to determine the exact symptoms by gathering relevant information:

step2.para: What else occurred at that time?

svcproc.para: Verify the problem. Is the complaint due to mis-understood customer selected parameters? Use Prolink EST to review customer selected parameters.

step1.para: Check for and recordany logged fault codes.

step2.para: Do the logged codes correlate to probable causes?
Were the codes logged about the same time as the symptoms appeared? Were the codes logged repeatedly?
Are the logged codes related to other symptoms? Do they have a common cause?

step1.para: Avoid Preconceived Ideas! Eliminate any non-electrical causes for the problem first (contaminated fuel, clogged air filters etc.).
